title: Increased number of firms increases shoe supply

content.question: Which of the following will cause the supply curve for shoes to shift to the right?

choices.label: An increase in the price of socks, assuming that shoes and socks are complements
A decrease in the price of sandals, assuming that shoes and sandals are substitutes
An increase in the wages of shoe workers
An increase in the number of firms producing shoes
A decrease in the income of consumers, assuming that shoes are normal goods

content.answer: An increase in the number of firms producing shoes

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
